verses.kjv: Open thy doors, O Lebanon, that the fire may devour thy cedars.
verses.ct: Throw open your gates, Lebanon, so that fire can consume your cedars.

verses.kjv: Howl, fir tree; for the cedar is fallen; because the mighty are spoiled: howl, O ye oaks of Bashan; for the forest of the vintage is come down.
verses.ct: Cry out, cypress tree, because the cedar has fallen! The mighty trees have been destroyed. Cry out, oaks of Bashan, because the dense forest has been cut down.

verses.kjv: There is a voice of the howling of the shepherds; for their glory is spoiled: a voice of the roaring of young lions; for the pride of Jordan is spoiled.
verses.ct: Listen to the wailing of the shepherds, because their rich pastures are ruined. Listen to the roaring of young lions, because the thick growth along the Jordan is destroyed.

verses.kjv: Thus saith the LORD my God; Feed the flock of the slaughter;
verses.ct: This is what the LORD my God said: "Take care of the flock marked for slaughter."

verses.kjv: Whose possessors slay them, and hold themselves not guilty: and they that sell them say, Blessed be the LORD; for I am rich: and their own shepherds pity them not.
verses.ct: Their buyers kill them and feel no guilt. Those who sell them say, 'Praise the LORD, I've gotten rich!' Their own shepherds show them no compassion.

verses.kjv: For I will no more pity the inhabitants of the land, saith the LORD: but, lo, I will deliver the men every one into his neighbour’s hand, and into the hand of his king: and they shall smite the land, and out of their hand I will not deliver them.
verses.ct: "Because I will no longer show compassion to the people living in this land," declares the LORD. "Instead, I will hand everyone over to their neighbor and to their king. They will devastate the land, and I will not rescue anyone from their power."

verses.kjv: And I will feed the flock of slaughter, even you, O poor of the flock. And I took unto me two staves; the one I called Beauty, and the other I called Bands; and I fed the flock.
verses.ct: So I cared for the flock marked for slaughter — specifically you, the oppressed of the flock. I took 2 staffs for myself; one I named Favor, and the other I named Unity. Then I shepherded the flock.

verses.kjv: Three shepherds also I cut off in one month; and my soul lothed them, and their soul also abhorred me.
verses.ct: I got rid of 3 shepherds in a single month. I grew impatient with the flock, and they also despised me.

verses.kjv: Then said I, I will not feed you: that that dieth, let it die; and that that is to be cut off, let it be cut off; and let the rest eat every one the flesh of another.
verses.ct: Then I said, "I will no longer be your shepherd. Let the dying die, and let the perishing perish. Let those who are left devour each other."

verses.kjv: And I took my staff, even Beauty, and cut it asunder, that I might break my covenant which I had made with all the people.
verses.ct: I took my staff called Favor and snapped it in two, breaking the covenant I had made with all the peoples.

verses.kjv: And it was broken in that day: and so the poor of the flock that waited upon me knew that it was the word of the LORD.
verses.ct: It was broken that very day, and the oppressed of the flock who were watching me recognized that this was the word of the LORD.

verses.kjv: And I said unto them, If ye think good, give me my price; and if not, forbear. So they weighed for my price thirty pieces of silver.
verses.ct: I told them, "If you think it's right, pay me my wages. But if not, don't bother." So they counted out my payment — 30 pieces of silver.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto me, Cast it unto the potter: a goodly price that I was prised at of them. And I took the thirty pieces of silver, and cast them to the potter in the house of the LORD.
verses.ct: The LORD told me, "Throw it to the potter — that magnificent price they valued me at!" So I took the 30 pieces of silver and threw them to the potter in the house of the LORD.

verses.kjv: Then I cut asunder mine other staff, even Bands, that I might break the brotherhood between Judah and Israel.
verses.ct: Then I snapped my other staff, Unity, in two, breaking the bond of brotherhood between Judah and Israel.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto me, Take unto thee yet the instruments of a foolish shepherd.
verses.ct: The LORD told me, "Now take the equipment of a worthless shepherd."

verses.kjv: For, lo, I will raise up a shepherd in the land, which shall not visit those that be cut off, neither shall seek the young one, nor heal that that is broken, nor feed that that standeth still: but he shall eat the flesh of the fat, and tear their claws in pieces.
verses.ct: "Because I am going to raise up a shepherd over the land who will not care for the dying, will not search for the young, will not heal the injured, or feed the healthy. Instead, he will eat the meat of the choice sheep and rip off their hooves."

verses.kjv: Woe to the idol shepherd that leaveth the flock! the sword shall be upon his arm, and upon his right eye: his arm shall be clean dried up, and his right eye shall be utterly darkened.
verses.ct: How terrible it will be for the worthless shepherd who abandons the flock! May a sword strike his arm and his right eye! May his arm wither completely, and may his right eye go totally blind.
